 In neat@yahoogroups.com, "Ken Lloyd" <kalloyd@...> wrote:
>
> Evert,
>  
>=
 Yeah, I've re-architected NEAT in such a way as to be compatible for the
>=
 Boost Graph Library - or any other graph library for that matter.  I poste=
d
> the general namespaces to this list about a month ago. If you would lik=
e
> specifics, I can send you the code (in C#)  The advantange of this form=
 of
> separation of concerns is the ability to easily configure a graph lib=
rary as
> the foundation structure for any derived network, neural network,=
 and/or
> genome then extend this to NEAT or HyperNEAT.
>  
> A lot of this=
 decision to use Boost or other graph library is predicated on
> the way it=
 handles n-dimensional vertices (either simple or complex)
> associated wit=
h the nodes.
>  
> Ken Lloyd
